author: Kolkata Bureau
text:
In an unprecedented event, a few dozen activists of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) staged a protest at the State headquarters of the party against the allocation of Bhatpara seat to the Janata Dal (United). The party activists, who later explained to the media that there was “no justification” for offering the seat in North 24 Paraganas to (JDU).

The CPI-M candidate Jeetendra Sahu had a good chance of winning in Bhatpara, they said. The activists sought a meeting to explain their grievance.
title: Protest over seat allocation
